    • Method Detail

      • onStartAnimation

        public void onStartAnimation(List<Bulb> bulbs,
                             long timestamp)
        Description copied from interface: AnimationStrategy
        Whenever your animation is started, this is the first method to be called by the framework. You can use it to set up internal data structures that will last for the whole animation. Please also tear down this data structures in #onEndAnimation.
        Specified by:
        onStartAnimation in interface AnimationStrategy
        Parameters:
        bulbs - The list of all bulbs gives you the number of them as well as the position and color of each one.
        timestamp - Provides a view at the clock ( System.currentTimeMillis() ) is a consistant way.

      • onStartFrame

                         long timestamp)
        Specified by:

                       long timestamp)

      • onEndAnimation

        public void onEndAnimation(List<Bulb> bulbs,
                           long timestamp)
        Description copied from interface: AnimationStrategy
        When your animation is ended, this is the last method to be called by the framework. You should use it to clean up after you. Thanks.
        Specified by:
        onEndAnimation in interface AnimationStrategy
        Parameters:
        bulbs - The list of all bulbs gives you the number of them as well as position and color of each one.
        timestamp - Provides a view at the clock ( System.currentTimeMillis() ) is a consistant way.

      • calcFrame

        public void calcFrame(List<Bulb> bulbs,
                      long timestamp)
        Calculation all colors of #Bulp's one at a time in the order given. Note: Other implementations may calculate multiple #Bulp's in parallel.
        Specified by:
        calcFrame in interface AnimationStrategy
        Parameters:
        bulbs - ordered list of Bulbs (grouping index, (x,y,z), rgb for each LED)
        timestamp - current time in milliseconds
